verses.text: \w Woe|strong="H1945"\w* to the \w bloody|strong="H1818"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w*! it \add is\add* all \w full|strong="H4392"\w* of \w lies|strong="H3585"\w* \add and\add* \w robbery|strong="H6563"\w*; the \w prey|strong="H2964"\w* \w departeth|strong="H4185"\w* not;\f + \fr 3.1 \ft bloody…: Heb. city of bloods\f*

The \w noise|strong="H6963"\w* of a \w whip|strong="H7752"\w*, and the \w noise|strong="H6963"\w* of the \w rattling|strong="H7494"\w* of the \w wheels|strong="H0212"\w*, and of the \w pransing|strong="H1725"\w* \w horses|strong="H5483"\w*, and of the \w jumping|strong="H7540"\w* \w chariots|strong="H4818"\w*.

The \w horseman|strong="H6571"\w* lifteth \w up|strong="H5927"\w* both the \w bright|strong="H3851"\w* \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* and the \w glittering|strong="H1300"\w* \w spear|strong="H2595"\w*: and \add there is\add* a \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of \w slain|strong="H2491"\w*, and a \w great|strong="H3514"\w* number of \w carcases|strong="H6297"\w*; and \add there is\add* none \w end|strong="H7097"\w* of \add their\add* \w corpses|strong="H1472"\w*; they \w stumble|strong="H3782"\w* upon their \w corpses|strong="H1472"\w*:\f + \fr 3.3 \ft the bright…: Heb. the flame of the sword, and the lightning of the spear\f*

Because of the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of the \w whoredoms|strong="H2183"\w* of the \w wellfavoured|strong="H2896"\w* \w harlot|strong="H2181"\w*, the \w mistress|strong="H1172"\w* of \w witchcrafts|strong="H3785"\w*, that \w selleth|strong="H4376"\w* \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* through her \w whoredoms|strong="H2183"\w*, and \w families|strong="H4940"\w* through her \w witchcrafts|strong="H3785"\w*.

Behold, I \add am\add* against thee, \w saith|strong="H5002"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of \w hosts|strong="H6635"\w*; and I will \w discover|strong="H1540"\w* thy \w skirts|strong="H7757"\w* upon thy \w face|strong="H6440"\w*, and I will \w shew|strong="H7200"\w* the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* thy \w nakedness|strong="H4626"\w*, and the \w kingdoms|strong="H4467"\w* thy \w shame|strong="H7036"\w*.

And I will \w cast|strong="H7993"\w* abominable \w filth|strong="H8251"\w* upon thee, and make thee \w vile|strong="H5034"\w*, and will \w set|strong="H7760"\w* thee as a \w gazingstock|strong="H7210"\w*.

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* all they that \w look|strong="H7200"\w* upon thee shall \w flee|strong="H5074"\w* from thee, and \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Nineveh|strong="H5210"\w* is laid \w waste|strong="H7703"\w*: who will \w bemoan|strong="H5110"\w* her? \w whence|strong="H0370"\w* shall I \w seek|strong="H1245"\w* \w comforters|strong="H5162"\w* for thee?

Art thou \w better|strong="H3190"\w* than \w populous|strong="H0527"\w* \w No|strong="H4996"\w*, that was \w situate|strong="H3427"\w* among the \w rivers|strong="H2975"\w*, \add that had\add* the \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* round \w about|strong="H5439"\w* it, whose \w rampart|strong="H2426"\w* \add was\add* the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*, \add and\add* her \w wall|strong="H2346"\w* \add was\add* from the \w sea|strong="H3220"\w*?\f + \fr 3.8 \ft populous…: or, nourishing, etc: Heb. No Amon\f*

\w Ethiopia|strong="H3568"\w* and \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* \add were\add* her \w strength|strong="H6109"\w*, and \add it was\add* \w infinite|strong="H0369"\w*; \w Put|strong="H6316"\w* and \w Lubim|strong="H3864"\w* were thy \w helpers|strong="H5833"\w*.\f + \fr 3.9 \ft thy helpers: Heb. in thy help\f*

Yet \add was\add* she carried \w away|strong="H1473"\w*, she \w went|strong="H1980"\w* into \w captivity|strong="H7628"\w*: her young \w children|strong="H5768"\w* also were dashed in \w pieces|strong="H7376"\w* at the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* of all the \w streets|strong="H2351"\w*: and they \w cast|strong="H3032"\w* \w lots|strong="H1486"\w* for her honourable \w men|strong="H3513"\w*, and all her great \w men|strong="H1419"\w* were \w bound|strong="H7576"\w* in \w chains|strong="H2131"\w*.

Thou also shalt be \w drunken|strong="H7937"\w*: thou shalt be \w hid|strong="H5956"\w*, thou also shalt \w seek|strong="H1245"\w* \w strength|strong="H4581"\w* because of the \w enemy|strong="H0341"\w*.

All thy strong \w holds|strong="H4013"\w* \add shall be like\add* fig \w trees|strong="H8384"\w* with the firstripe \w figs|strong="H1061"\w*: if they be \w shaken|strong="H5128"\w*, they shall even \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* into the \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* of the \w eater|strong="H0398"\w*.

Behold, thy \w people|strong="H5971"\w* in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* of thee \add are\add* \w women|strong="H0802"\w*: the \w gates|strong="H8179"\w* of thy \w land|strong="H0776"\w* shall be set \w wide|strong="H6605"\w* \w open|strong="H6605"\w* unto thine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*: the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* shall \w devour|strong="H0398"\w* thy \w bars|strong="H1280"\w*.

\w Draw|strong="H7579"\w* thee \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* for the \w siege|strong="H4692"\w*, \w fortify|strong="H2388"\w* thy strong \w holds|strong="H4013"\w*: \w go|strong="H0935"\w* into \w clay|strong="H2916"\w*, and \w tread|strong="H7429"\w* the \w morter|strong="H2563"\w*, make \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* the \w brickkiln|strong="H4404"\w*.

There shall the \w fire|strong="H0784"\w* \w devour|strong="H0398"\w* thee; the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* shall cut thee \w off|strong="H3772"\w*, it shall eat thee \w up|strong="H0398"\w* like the \w cankerworm|strong="H3218"\w*: make thyself \w many|strong="H3513"\w* as the \w cankerworm|strong="H3218"\w*, make thyself \w many|strong="H3513"\w* as the \w locusts|strong="H0697"\w*.

Thou hast \w multiplied|strong="H7235"\w* thy \w merchants|strong="H7402"\w* above the \w stars|strong="H3556"\w* of \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*: the \w cankerworm|strong="H3218"\w* \w spoileth|strong="H6584"\w*, and flieth \w away|strong="H5774"\w*.\f + \fr 3.16 \ft spoileth: or, spreadeth himself\f*

Thy \w crowned|strong="H4502"\w* \add are\add* as the \w locusts|strong="H0697"\w*, and thy \w captains|strong="H2951"\w* as the great \w grasshoppers|strong="H1462"\w*, which \w camp|strong="H2583"\w* in the \w hedges|strong="H1448"\w* in the \w cold|strong="H7135"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, \add but\add* when the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* \w ariseth|strong="H2224"\w* they flee \w away|strong="H5074"\w*, and their \w place|strong="H4725"\w* is not \w known|strong="H3045"\w* \w where|strong="H0335"\w* they \add are\add*.

Thy \w shepherds|strong="H7462"\w* \w slumber|strong="H5123"\w*, O \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*: thy \w nobles|strong="H0117"\w* shall \w dwell|strong="H7931"\w* \add in the dust:\add* thy \w people|strong="H5971"\w* is \w scattered|strong="H6335"\w* upon the \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w*, and no man \w gathereth|strong="H6908"\w* \add them\add*.\f + \fr 3.18 \ft nobles: or, valiant ones\f*

\add There is\add* no \w healing|strong="H3545"\w* of thy \w bruise|strong="H7667"\w*; thy \w wound|strong="H4347"\w* is \w grievous|strong="H2470"\w*: all that \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* the \w bruit|strong="H8088"\w* of thee shall \w clap|strong="H8628"\w* the \w hands|strong="H3709"\w* over thee: for upon whom hath not thy \w wickedness|strong="H7451"\w* \w passed|strong="H5674"\w* \w continually|strong="H8548"\w*?\f + \fr 3.19 \ft healing: Heb. wrinkling\f*
